events.name: The Design & Content Panel
events.short-desc: We’re partnering with The Design & Content Conference to bring the Style & Class community an exciting panel on the intersection of web design and content strategy. To make a bit more room (okay, a lot more room) we’re hosting the panel at The Rio Theatre in East Vancouver.

description.p: We’re partnering with The Design & Content Conference to bring the Style & Class community an exciting panel on the intersection of web design and content strategy. To make a bit more room (okay, a lot more room) we’re hosting the panel at The Rio Theatre in East Vancouver.
Join us for a round table discussion featuring some of the web's top thinkers. Moderated by Steve Fisher, this panel is sure to provoke conversation and debate.
Doors open at 6:30pm, panel starts at 7:00pm. No admittance after 7:15pm.
Important note: though free, this is a ticketed event in a venue with limited capacity. Those not on the RSVP list are not guaranteed a seat.

events.sponsor-description: Without the support of sponsors and partners, this event would be nearly impossible to organize and run. A huge thanks for their generous support of a community event!

events.name: Coding for Beauty
events.short-desc: As core languages of the web, we're well familiar with HTML and CSS. Are they necessarily just production languages, or can they deliver creative freedom?

description.p: As core languages of the web, we're well familiar with HTML and CSS. Are they necessarily just production languages, or can they deliver creative freedom?
Doors open at 6:30pm, talks start at 7:00pm. No admittance after 7:15pm. You must be registered with Meetup to attend.
An assortment of beer and soft drinks will be provided, no food. 19+, minors not permitted due to alcohol service.

talks.title: Email Development... Yes, It's a Thing
Designing it Better in the Browser

events.afterwards: We’ll head out to the nearby The New Oxford Tavern after the event to have some more drinks and some more nuanced conversation. If you can make it, we'd love to see you there!

events.name: Designing with Passion
events.short-desc: Many of us spend our days designing for things we aren't necessarily passionate about. Design is our job. And that doesn't mean we don't love doing it and that we aren't excited. But it's also not really what we care about. Instead, we turn to passion projects on our off time to really show off what we care about. Please join us as we spend an evening taking a look at what it means to be passionate about your design work and the amazing things that can come out of it.

description.p: Many of us spend our days designing for things we aren't necessarily passionate about. Design is our job. And that doesn't mean we don't love doing it and that we aren't excited. But it's also not really what we care about. Instead, we turn to passion projects on our off time to really show off what we care about. Please join us as we spend an evening taking a look at what it means to be passionate about your design work and the amazing things that can come out of it.
Doors open at 6:30pm, talks start at 7:00pm. No admittance after 7:15pm. You must be registered with Meetup to attend.
An assortment of beer and soft drinks will be provided, no food. 19+, minors not permitted due to alcohol service.

talks.title: Efficient Web Type, c. 1556
Confessions of a Luddite

events.afterwards: We tend to head to Tap & Barrel after the event to have some drinks and more nuanced conversation. If you can make it, we'd love to see you there!

events.name: Design Storytelling
events.short-desc: Join us for an evening of 5 short talks of design storytelling. During your career you’ll experience defining moments that stand out in your memory. Sometimes these moments are funny, sometimes they make you think, and every now and then you learn a valuable lesson that informs the rest of your career. Our speakers will share their own personal moments, and what impact they had.

description.p: Join us for an evening of 4 short talks of design storytelling. During your career you’ll experience defining moments that stand out in your memory. Sometimes these moments are funny, sometimes they make you think, and every now and then you learn a valuable lesson that informs the rest of your career. Our speakers will share some of their own defining moments and the lessons those moments can teach us.
Doors open at 6:30pm, talks start at 7:00pm. No admittance after 7:15pm.
An assortment of beer and soft drinks will be provided, no food. 19+, minors not permitted due to alcohol service.

talks.title: Clients from Hell, or Learning Opportunities?
Without Agency
Prototyping Your Way to Happiness: An Adventure with Pattern Lab
Out in the Open

events.afterwards: As this is our first S&C in Yaletown, we’ll be trying out the nearby The New Oxford Tavern after the event to have some more drinks and some more nuanced conversation. If you can make it, we'd love to see you there!

events.name: The Style & Class Conference After Party

description.p: Doors open at 7pm. Drinks and light snacks will be served.

events.name: The Style & Class Conference
events.short-desc: We’ve taken everything you love about our meetups, the heart and soul, and partnered with two amazing organizations, Smashing Conference and Ladies Learning Code, to create an incredible day of high-quality conference talks.

description.p: We’ve taken everything you love about our meetups, the heart and soul, and partnered with two amazing organizations, Smashing Conference and Ladies Learning Code, to create an incredible day of high-quality conference talks.

Tickets are only $20 and we’re donating all profits to Ladies Learning Code, a Canada-wide not-for-profit group working to empower everyone to feel comfortable learning beginner-friendly technical skills in a social, collaborative way. We have a limited numbers of tickets and Style and Class always sells out, so get yours now!
Doors open at 12:00pm (noon) and talks get rolling at 1pm.

events.accessibility: The Style & Class Conference will be accessible for the hearing impaired.

talks.title: All The Right Moves: Putting your UIs in Motion
Content Strategy For Designers
Improving Smashing Magazine's Performance: A Case-Study
Peer Influence, Pop Culture, and the Power of Human-Centred Design
Accessibility With CSS: Making Websites Better for Everyone
15 Years of Responsive Web Design

events.short-desc: Who are you building for? Different audiences require different design considerations. For our May event, we'll hear about CSS best practices for building accessible sites and creating scalable, maintainable CSS at the enterprise level.

events.short-desc: In our November meetup, we'll hear about the challenges of pushing the boundaries in web design with creaky old content management systems, and the importance of how your users perceive the performance of your site.
